submission_categories.description: describe directions for research into Formal Methods for Autonomous Systems
describe well-defined research ideas that are in their early stages
report on practical experiences in applying Formal Methods to Autonomous Systems
describe completed applications of Formal Methods to an Autonomous System

submission_info.submission_guidelines: Submissions must be prepared using the EPTCS LaTeX style.
submission_info.review_process: Each submission will receive at least three single-blind reviews.

summary.event: 7th International Workshop on Formal Methods for Autonomous Systems (FMAS 2025)

co_located_events.event_name: International Conference on Integrated Formal Methods (iFM) 2025

registration.requirements: At least one author per paper must register for, and attend, the workshop to present their work.

summary.description: FMAS 2025 is a 2.5-day peer-reviewed international workshop that brings together researchers working on a range of techniques for the formal verification of autonomous systems.

publication_details.best_paper_award: FMAS 2025 will honour the best paper selected with respect to reviews, programme committee discussions, and conference presentations with an award.

topics_of_interest: Applicable, tool-supported Formal Methods that are suited to Autonomous Systems
Runtime Verification or other formal approaches to deal with the reality gap
Verification against safety assurance arguments or standards documents
Formal specification, modelling, and requirements engineering approaches for autonomous systems
Case Studies that identify challenges when applying formal methods to autonomous systems
Experience Reports that provide guidance for tackling challenges with formal methods or tools
Discussions of the future directions of the field
Special Topic: Formal methods for human-AI teamwork
